text: A young man named Devon waited on myself and my family his service was exceptional. Prompt friendly and professional at all times that being said the food was great lobster tail French onion soup and a perfectly cooked steak. I'd order the food to go anytime but Devons service will keep me coming back as often as possible.
Great food and drinks.... we like coming here but patio bar is always closed......Saturday day drinking denied!

Oh my Oh my...the prices are really not bad at all. I would say it's a great place to hang out with friends to grab a few drinks and watch the football games considering the fact that there's lots of TVs. 

Food was great and the service was excellent! I ordered the seafood medley $13.99, one word can describe this pasta DELICIOUS. My bf ordered the seafood platter (sorry I don't know the actual name) but it came with crab, 2 corns, potatoes, shrimp, clams, mussels, lobster, and clam chowder soup for $16.99. Doesn't it just make your mouth water just thinking about it? As for the starters we ordered the crab mozzarella, it was yummy. The best for last dessert....Captain Jack's is a total must try!

The food isn't spectacular but for the price you can't beat it.  Get the baby back ribs.  Their half rack vs. full rack pricing is the only one in this town that makes any sense.  Plus they're really good.  But bottom line this is one of the best places to grab a few drinks.  Their specials are many and their prices are absolutely nothing to complain about.  A lot of tvs for games too.

Service was great but the best was Joey bringing me my bottle of rootbeer (driving) then disappearing only to come back with a glass with a big scoop of Blue Bunny vanilla ice cream so i could have a rootbeer float! Thank you Joey for making a great time with my girlfriends even better! You rock!

My  family and I went back today to try this place again.  The "Zingers" were very good and the crab dinner once again didn't disappoint.  My daughter and I each had salads (the Zinger salad and the steak salad.). They were both good, although really needed more dressing.  The ice cream pie again was delicious and the brownie sundae was crazy huge.  No table could finish that much dessert.  The only things that need work are the French onion soup which was too salty and over cooked, and the onion rings which I am sure come frozen and then fried so that they do not taste fresh nor crisp.  Overall it is a chain bar restaurant and not fancy, creative dining.  Stick to their drinks, which look delicious.

I would give Bartender Brian C 5 stars for excellent service and fun entertainment, hower manager Jerry has made this restaurant less than a single star. Me and my girlfriend came here after a concert for some drinks and a late night snack. We got the zinger mountain melt with the special request that we have it half honey mustard and half sweet chilli Thai with a side of both ranch and blue cheese. Now I don't see a problem in this seeing how other restaurants can accommodate our needs but apparently there was and manager Jerry came out to make that clear to our bartender. Feeling bad for our selection of choice I told the manager that Brian was an excellent bar tender and doing a great job, Jerry's response was just eat your food as he walked away. Wow!!! My mind was blown.. I have never been so insulted by a manager at a restaraunt when giving his staff a compliment. Ridiculous. I should have known that if Jerry would treat his own employees like crap, the. It is certain he would treat his guests like that too... I certainly will never be back for their mediocre greasy food and to be told to eat it instead of pay respects to my service. 

Horrible Manager!!!!!
I came in last night with my friend we got really good service from the bartender Stephen very attentive. I had a mojito that was very delicious!

Got off to a bad start right away waited to be seated for 8min with the place only holding no more then 10 customers and a ton off staff finally the guy working the bar came over seated and seated us we got to ordering and me and the wife decided on shrimp tacos that weren't even grilled no flavor at all food was very disappointing tacos consisted of boiled shrimp lettuce cheese and a side of black beans with rice also flavorless I'm surprised the drinks weren't flat

This is always a nice chill restaurant to go to if you want to have some drinks and bar food.  It's nothing fancy so there's no need to get dressed up.  It's a cool place to go to with friends, the food isn't bad, and they have good drinks.  The spinach and artichoke dip is delicious and the staff is always friendly!

Located in the very nice and conveniently located Town Square, just South of the famous "Welcome to Las Vegas" sign, this casual dining joint is a breath of fresh air.  Reasonably priced menu items, with regular specials.  If you're looking for a clean, casual, not too hectic place to dine, you probably can't go wrong.

We took advantage of a $9 steak dinner, which came with two sides (broccoli and baked potato for me).  The steak was a bit tough, and at 6 ounces probably won't fit the bill for people looking to stuff themselves, but it tasted good enough for $9.  It may seem as though the best part of the dining experience was the price, and that's a great thing for sure, but everybody in the joint seemed to be having a good time, and (most importantly) we didn't feel the rush one normally feels at a Strip restaurant.

excellant place....great food great prices,,,
stays open really alte too.

bar gets pretty loud and rowdy latenight.

one of my vegas favs....
Wednesday night lobster special 16.99 can't go wrong.   Cold beer hot food who would complain with that. Plenty of tv's to watch all your favorite sport's. Ill be coming nack soon

So coming from Florida where Miller's Ale House is just about everywhere; I was super excited when I heard the news that they were coming to Las Vegas!!! With all the time I spent at the ones in Florida I know how the experience should be.  
So far Vegas isn't doing too bad, the staff is friendly and gives you that "glad to see you again" attitude that they are famous for, and it gives you that "home" feeling when you walk through those doors, at least for me :)
The kitchen is not as great as I remember, not to say the food is not good it's just that I have had a couple of hiccups that used to not happen at the others I used to frequent.  I will definitely not five up on this place and as of late it has got better!  So as of right now I give it 4 out of 5 stars and I will be there often hoping that they get their fifth!

Recently received a email from them stating a Super bowl  buffet for the price of $25.00  When I called them to do it they said it  was $50.00 a person Talked to the manager and said  for me to email him the  email I got I did and no response back Since then they changed the email and the price to $50.00.I would think that is kinda  no class for them  not to call me and honor the first price I saw.

I drive by their billboard everyday on the way to work and never really payed attention.  I was stuck at the light so I finally checked it out and it said something like "It's always Happy Hour." I checked out the menu and specials online and it looked good.  There was a hockey game on and they have a boat-load of TVs so a couple of friends and I gave it a try... twice!!

the place is huge and they have HD TVs allllllllllll over the place!!  There is a cozy outside lounge-type area, a large main area with lotsa booths and table, big bar, and even a pool table, and a decent sized lanai-type area with it's own bar.  we sat in the latter both times.  service was pretty decent and food came out fairly fast.

Both trips were on Mondays. they have a special on Mondays of a full rack of ribs with fries (or baked or mashed potatoes) and a lil cup of cole slaw for $10.95.  decent ribs made better by the price! the Zinger Mountain Melt was very good. ample serving of Zingers, fries, cheese, bacon bits and scallions. Yummy!  on the second trip we tried the chicken nachos.  portion was huge, chicken was dry and the rest of the toppings were kinda underwhelming.  the chips were really good though!

Mondays you can also get 5 Miller bottles for $7.95! 
pitchers of Miller products are only $7 all the time.

Overall great food and drink prices, food is decent, and service is good.  a great option other than Buffalo Wild Wings or Steiner's to watch a game.

Great fan of Miller's Alehouse.

Family and friends agree.. the best Chicken strips on the planet (called Zingers). As for me Battered style vs grilled. 

I also love Pepperoni Flat Bread....of course add Jalepenios. extra crispy. 


Staff is incredible! friendly and you won't necessarily get your food from you waitress. A well coordinated operation for getting your food to you hot, fresh and asap. I really like that! 

I've eaten at Town Square Location and Stephanie. My experience at both has been parallel. No surprises.

I love this place! My husband and I go there almost weekly. Great food, sizeable portions, variety of drink options, great atmosphere and very reasonable prices. You can sit on the patio and enjoy your dinner outside or if your  more of an inside eater there is plenty of room. We've had poor servers from time to time but all in all a great place to eat. We will continue to visit this place on a regular basis.

Awesome service, yummy food, and affordable drinks! A great place to grab a bite and to have a few drinks with friends or to watch the game! Try the zingers with the honey sriracha lime and mango habanero sauces mixed together! Yummy!  Wash it down with a cold beer! Delicious!

I visited Miller's Alehouse for the first time last Saturday night. I gave it 4 stars for great first impression. I might have given it 5 stars but we just had salads and dessert. They were great. I will order more the next time. The atmosphere was great. Our waitress was Cat (Catherine) and she gave us excellent service. The prices were very reasonable and there was lots of choices on the menu. Hey, how many places offer ossobuco and at less than 15 bucks! It's definitely a place I would go back to - and also recommend.

First time at miller's ale and I am hooked. Delicious appetizers.  Even better spirits. I had the mango pinapple mojito and I recommend it. I had the two lobster tail dinner and it was so so good. I will definitely come back and bring some friends. The atmosphere was calm yet entertaining.  Lots of t.v's . You can watch any sport event . Fun fun fun

Don't expect a tall beer here. They will only serve 32oz beers in miller and blue moon. Why? No reason. I just wanted a big Fat Tire to end my day, but the bartenders insisted it was out of their hands. I hope this gets changed ASAP.

These people know how to cook a steak. It was juicy and evenly cooked throughout. I ordered the 12oz blackened ribeye and took half of it home. The pomegranate margarita was mediocre - about as good as a glass of kool-aid. The blackened chicken quesadillas was decent. I enjoyed the calamari, it tasted similar to the way the Macaroni Grill used to prepare theirs. 

As for the atmosphere, it was very loud indoors. I had to lean over and speak up to talk to everyone at the table. The service was great,  our server was very attentive and provided prompt service.

Food is good and is a ok place to hang out. I've been there several times but actually got in only twice. They seem to have little space for a family or friends of 4 to sit and hang out. It's always full. Sounds good right but actually I think it's because they have a lot if tv's within the eating areas abc people just sit around watching tv.

Let me start off by saying I am always trying to find positive things to say about local spots here in Las Vegas. I went to watch the Mayweather fight on May 3rd here and was charged to share a table with multiple people! The DJ was rude during the National Anthem and when the fight ended , The DJ turned the Music Up and didn't allow the fans to Hear the words of the Champ!!! I wouldn't recommend this place for any boxing fans Ever!!

This this place is great!  My wife and I were bored and went to town square to do some shopping and we stopped in for a bite to eat. Our server was Farren who was a sweet heart and was on top of everything. The food was really good too, I ordered the fish amd chips andy wife ordered the chicken tossed salad. We both loved our food. For the quality of service and food you get here, this place is dirt cheap. You gotta try it!
Came here for game day. All the games are on, lots of action. Staff is very friendly, and the food is great!

I love this place. They have good food and a friendly staff.  It has that back home feel to it.  Good place to watch football too.  I just with they had more beers to choose form. Other then that, its amazing.
Its a nice place to hang out. Also expect to pay above average for beverages. Service is good.

Just called to see if they will be showing the Paquiao/Mayweather fight and got interrupted in the middle of my question and then she hung up on me. Haha! That's what a JOB is...Just Over Broke so not much love there....

great drinks.... glad the bartender switched me over to an energy drink infused cocktail.   Just in time too, I wouldn't have lasted another minute.   I didn't eat here, saving 4 stars for when I do and they deserve it.   or 5 if they are terrific.
Place is pathetic.  Service not that great.  Food is mediocre.  For a place having a full bar they don't even carry Coke products.  Makes you wonder how they would make a rum and coke drink.

The first thing I have to say about Miller's Ale House is the Burger is Great. One  thing I love is a good burger. I thought I would give theirs a try as it was my first time at the Ale House. When the burger arrived, a big portion of it was hanging over the edge of the bun. I took a healthy bite of the meat all by itself. What a pleasure that was. The meat was moist while being cooked properly. The flavor had a savoriness that did not mask the beefiness. This tasted like a good piece of beef should. I got the British burger that has Swiss Cheese and Bacon on top. Every aspect of the burger were done properly. Even the bun served well. It was not too soft or hard and complemented the rest of the sandwich.

My wife got the fish and chips, so I gave the fish a try. Not bad at all. The fish tasted
nice and the breading had a good crunch to it.

The fries were good. Not great and nothing to make a special trip there for, but good.

Our server was wonderful. She made sure we were well taken care of. Our drink glasses were never empty and everything was cleared from the table right after we emptied them. The decor is OK. It is like a lot of restaurants that have the same fare. I do look forward to going back again.

Came here on Labor Day for lunch.  Wanted to try the daily special which is a full rack of baby back ribs for 10.99.  Totally worth it!  Tried the Nutter Butter ice cream dessert.  WOW!  Delicious!  The drink prices are very affordable.  Glad I looked up all the places in the shopping center here at Town Center.  This place is on our go to list for all our future Vegas trips (at least 2x a year).  Just wish we had one near where we live.
My fav place to watch a game & get some decent bar food! They always have great drink specials.

We had a Mixer here on February 6th 2015 from 4-6. Jon the GM at this location was by far the best Manager I've ever dealt with. For the STAFF MEMBERS... I CAN'T PUT INTO WORDS OF HOW INCREDIBLE THEY ARE. I would highly recommend this location any day of the WEEK! 
THANK YOU AGAIN JON AND STAFF

I eat here twice a week good lunch specials.  For the best service go to the back bar and ask for Clay he's been there a long time and is great at his job.  Only downside to this place is the management other than that the food and service is above par!

They have numerous very good ales from all over . Their happy hour is discounted ales and drinks and appetizers. My favorite item is the lobster dinner on Wednesdays for $14.99. A 1 1/4  lb. lobster with sides. And if you go during happy hour on Wednesdays you can get happy hour drink specials and your lobster meal! Nice!

My buddy and I went to Miller's Alehouse today for lunch right next Frys Electronics and wow food was terrible. We were both disappointed in their food quality. It actually gave me a stomach ache. The service was good, but they still don't deserve any stars. We are not going back here again.
Typical sports bar. Nothing special.

I had to try this place , just curious to see what it was about. Mixed reviews on yelp , so just decided to give it a shot. 
We started of with the sampler app. it had mozzarella sticks more like planks. Conch fritters and crab balls with cheese ,everything was OK nothing stood out. First time for conch fritters , tasted fishy could it be old? I never had it before. , If was old then take another star away please. 
I had to osso buco (pork shank) it was huge and fall off the bone tender. I was covered in a dry rub, with some brown gravy . It came with mash potato and steamed broccoli, nothing special. I really enjoyed the osso buco . 
For dessert we had the capt buried treasure ice cream cake, it had heath bar crumbles, oreo cookie , carmel fudge and chocolate sauce. It was pretty good, as we were eating it wife was already planning next visit for dessert ! lol Pretty big and int resting menu , we will be back.

For a relatively new place, the beer selection is almost shockingly limited.  Do not think of this place as "Yard House II" because it is definitely not.

Almost as surprising is the highly unimaginative menu.  The food we had was well prepared, no complaints,  but the choices were very uninspired.

Were I thinking of opening a place of this sort at Town Square and this was my vision, my next thought would be: "why bother?".

Don't waste your time dining here. I suggest TGIF or Chili's for better food and service. The steak i ordered was dry and tough (I ordered medium rare). The fries were hard and tasteless. How the heck do you screw up fries???

I personally don't care for top-notched service but it is true what yelpers say: customer service here is terrible. We only saw our server twice. 1) to take our order and 2) for the bill. The only few things good about this restaurant are the food is reasonably priced and great atmosphere for sports fans. There are TVs everywhere.

Just ate here and I felt a review was necessary because I saw a few meek reviews here on Yelp. SO I thought I'd share my experience... I gave this place 5 stars because this was great food at a great price. I had the fish and chips, my son had the scampi pasta, and my husband had the "build your own" burger (daughter ordered off kid menu).... ALL WERE VERY DELICIOUS! Fast service and our server was sweet and attentive. I recommend this place if you want to get away from the over priced not so good food on the strip!!!! We will definitely be back!!
If it's Thursday we're here.  My husband loves the meatloaf special and it's only  $5.99!  Today they had a blackened salmon Caesar salad that was wonderful.

I mean I'm gonna start out by saying I was obviously here during shift change. That being said there's way too many employees they don't interact with customers my bartender Kimmie left without checking on me so I went 20 min at a bar completely ignored. The clam chowder was like a gravy and cool. This place is super unfriendly unengaging unprofessional the food is so super basic I do NOT recommend wasting ur time OR money here

Make sure you have no plans after dinner at this place.


Having the initial greeting from the waiter? FOREVER.

Waiting for our drinks? FOREVER.

Waiting for our food? FOREVER.

Even waiting just to see our waiter pass by? FOREVER.

Want a glass of water? 20 MINS 

Asked for our bill to come? FOREVER.

Waiting for the waiter to come back and get the bill? FOREVER AND A DAY!


I'm for the most part, a patient person. But this place is too much!! It wasn't like they were understaffed either. There were plenty of employees, so I don't know what their problem was. If you had plans to catch a movie after eating at this place....good luck making it on time.

The only reason why I gave 2 stars instead of 1 is because their food is actually decent and fairly priced. But  man, they sure do need to retrain the whole place or something. Come up with a new game plan because however they're running it, is sure not working.

I'm not the type of person to short a server on their tip , but in this case I made an exception ! Maybe if I had some drinks I wouldn't have notice!? 
 
 Started off cool , got our seats out on the patio area, got drinks, ordered our food ! After our food was served I noticed I didn't have a knife and my gf's side order of green beans haven't came out yet which I didn't mind cause we added it on a few minutes from ordering.
 So as we wait for our waitress  to come back I gave my girl my green beans so she could start eating , thinking I'll take her order she has coming on the way. 
 About 12 minutes later our waitress is back, I ask for a knife and more napkins , also mentioned my order of green beans i ordered on the side never came out..so she leaves. Her manager comes out with my knife and napkins and mentions that I mentioned something about green beans! I told her manager yes I was waiting on a side order of green beans and actually wanted to just cancel the order and to please make sure i didnt get charged for it since it's already been 15 + minutes..
 The manager then says ok let me go see what happened to your order of green beans. Manager comes back saying that " instead of bringing an order of green beans on the side, they just originally DOUBLED up the green beans on my plate! " but yes they will make sure I wasn't charged for it . 
   I was left there scratching my head* How do you respond to that? Even if so.. wouldn't you ask first if that was ok..? Also the portion that was given on my plate was not doubled.
 On another note watching the surrounding tables amongst being served by their servers, the waiter/waitress followed up by asking how's their meals ,is everything ok...OURS came 10/15 minutes later..The table next to us got free desert cause their waiter messed up on their order..
Well I gave them 2 stars because my girl liked her Mahi Mahi plate...the service ruined it for me!

I was introduced to the Alehouse during a stint of work in southwest Florida.  Happened to have an Alehouse within easy walking distance of my hotel (moderate stumbling distance on the way back!).  The food is definitely passable here, but I wish that they would put their Conch Chowder on the Vegas menu...that soup was amazing!  The bar has constant specials and this may be one of the most thrifty "popular" places in town to get your beverage on.  The bar also gets big props for carrying Licor 43...MINI BEERS!

I absolutely love Miller's.  When I go to Vegas I always make a point to stop in Town Square and eat at Miller's.  Doesn't matter which meal, lunch, dinner, it's all good.  A fun atmosphere and good food at great prices.  For me, service has always been good but then I am not a local so I have yet to see a bad side.  So much fun here during foorball season...Now if we can only get a Miller's in Southern Cal.

We have been to both locations and prefer the Town Square location.  We have been going there for over a year and continue to take friends, relatives and visitors there because the wait staff is outstanding,food is terrific and the cost is more than reasonable!  We have our two favorite staff members, Nikki and Joey.  Don't see Nikki much as we generally go when Joey is working.
He is outgoing, warm and genuinely cares that you enjoy your visit.
My favorite is the fish and chips.  The Sam Adams beer batter is the best and six large filets on the order.  Also get the 35 fried shrimp.
My wife prefers the flat iron steak and or a salad and you can add a lobster tail for $9.99!
Between the two of us we have probably tried 90% of the menu and have never had a bad meal and usually have a couple of meals because we almost always take some home and it is very good as left overs.
We have also had the company Christmas party there for two years running.  We will be returning this year and the restaurant was very accommodating.  All of our staff have become regulars at Miller's Ale House.

Prices are very reasonable... food is very average"

Caesar side salad was very good. Hamburger quite average. Fries... they are fries, not fresh, but OK. Onion Rings frozen and greasy. Beverage prices, very reasonable. Might try it again at home.
Pretty good bar food. Lots of selection. Loud atmosphere.

Terrible cocktails(we ordered extra shot because cocktails comes with no alcohol ) soggy watery shrimps  nasty! Cold chicken tenders !! Weird server !!! 
Blue moon pitcher saved the day

So I just happened to be around here and saw that this place isn't offered where I am from. Overall it has an outback steackhouse feel along with he menu. I ordered the Philly cheese steak which was not bad by any means, but didn't leave me speechless. Definitely hit the spot and was very filling. Our waitress was really friendly and helped me with everything I needed such as a different soup and condiments. Oh and tons of TVs to watch the game and great beers on tap. The fourth star is for the really good waitress.

Been here a few times and it's a clicky place. If you're not best friends with the bartender the don't even bother. Not to mention, I've seen the over zealous bouncers step way beyond there means multiple times in a single night. Saw them get arrested tonight which sparked this review. Never going back.

Terrible food!  I've tried three different entrees and they were all bad.  But it's a good spot to hangout and drink   Drinks are cheap and there is a large seating area for large groups.  Eat before you come!!
0 stars for food
4 for bar
Average: 2
Decent food and good beer. Service is hit and miss. Prices are reasonable for being in a tourist area. Lots of tvs for watching multiple games.
The Ale House is fricken awesome. Had THE best pizza in town. Tomatos, pepporoni, and extra garlic. I can't believe how incredibly good this meal is. Top Notch and 5 stars!

This review is based on two separate visits and both included just awful service. The first visit was on a Monday night at the bar, where the bartender took our food and drink order... and then was never heard of again. I mean literally, she and two others must have walked past me and my friend at least 10-15 times with not one word said until I stopped another random bartender for the bill.

Second visit was earlier today, a Sunday during the afternoon football games. I went to the podium, they asked me what game I wanted to watch, and they sat me in the area that they said would be playing the game. Of course, the game isn't playing and I missed the entire 1st quarter of it before one of the TV's was finally changed to that game, along with the waitress doing the same thing that happened my first visit: taking the order to never be seen again.

I feel it should also be mentioned that the table next to mine, as I was seated, waited a good 20 minutes before receiving their check and looked very disappointed. I jokingly asked them if they ever had a waitress, to which one of them said "We thought we did." The food is average by the way, nothing special to talk about. The chances of me coming back here are worse than one in a million... and no, I'm not saying there's chance ;)
Love this place! Cool spot for lunch and the lunch specials are great priced. The food is awesome! the server's are friendly and a great spot to watch sports.

We decided to try the Alehouse with some friends as it was new and it was time to give it a chance. After a somewhat brief wait since it was after 7 PM, so that is to be expected for anyplace at Town Square, we sat down and had our first drinks. My side of the group had beers, which were priced a little high in my opinion, but typical for any Vegas restaurant. The husband in the other couple had a double vodka tonic which I wished I had ordered since it was only $5, decent price. 

After this we started ordering our food, which we had all decided to split so we would all be able to try some different thing. We started off with the Calamari appetizer, which was fairly typical, but was splashed with a fairly lively sweet chili sauce and was actually pretty good. For our pass around main courses we ordered the Mini Burgers, Fish and Chips, and a full rack of the Baby Back Ribs. The burgers were cooked a little bit too long and really had nothing memorable about them at all. The Fish and Chips were not crisp at all and had way too much fishy taste to them, indicating that they had perhaps been sitting around too long. This was a little odd since the place hasn't been open long enough for anything to really be sitting around too long. They were pretty horrible in the end and I couldn't possible recommend them. The Ribs made as far as one rib per person before we all concurred that they were just horrible and we sent them back. Ribs them self are obviously all the same, and are completely dependent on their sauce and rub to bring them to life. These were on the stretcher and being covered with a sheet. The sauce had this odd taste to it that I couldn't even identify, and I would like to think that I have a sense of taste. 

Obviously the manager came over after we sent the ribs back, and fairly quickly, and offered us a free dessert after taking them off our bill. We decided on the Brownie Sundae, which was in my opinion not good, but my wife liked it and she is a far better judge of that as I am not a fan of brownie sundaes. I would have gone in another direction, but women usually get what they want. 

I realize that this place is not some standalone single-owned restaurant, but rather a location of a chain, so the thing you can't expect to change here is the menu. Knowing that it's a chain, the bugs should be worked out of the menu by now and things should be a little better than they were. 

I can't say all negative things about this place though. The manager was very quickly responsive to our dislike of the ribs, rather than making us sit there for a bit wondering what the status was. I cannot fault the staff at all since this restaurant is part of a larger machine and they are just going through the motions, doing their jobs. They have a lot of TVs, so you can distract yourself with some sport and hope you don't notice how the food tastes. 

The restaurant winds up being in the end like so many chain restaurants. No soul and no meaning. I couldn't even figure out what the theme was supposed to be. I saw someone on here say this place was better than The Yardhouse, but that must have been written by someone who doesn't like beer. Alehouse has about 15 beers on tap, which is slightly different than the Yardhouse. Plus the food at the Yardhouse seems to be much better from what I've eaten there. 

My final recommendation, if you're going to go eat at Miller's Alehouse, go somewhere else. It will probably work out more in your favor. Let this place be patronized by the people just going out to drink who don't care what they're eating.
Had dinner St Patty's weekend with bunch of friends. Good service. Good food at reasonable price. Parking is available everywhere. More upscale than PTs, not as "fancy" as Yard House.

LOVE LOVE LOVE this Miller's Ale House.  From the management personnel, Paul, Summer, Eric, John, and Steve to the awesome bartenders, Tim, Alex, Kimmie, Steve, Clay, Jennel, Ann, Amber, Reese, Dominique, we are treated so special.  As soon as we walk in the door, the TV's are put on our favorite sports teams, and our drinks are on the bar before we even sit down.  And a chair/stool with a back is brought for me at the bar because I don't like sitting on backless stools.  The food is delicious at reasonable prices, and the daily specials are exactly that, "special" especially the Monday rack of ribs, YUMMMMM!!!!  Doesn't get much better than that.  Treat yourself to a meal at the Miller's Ale House, and you will definitely become a regular

Avoid this tourist trap. The only reason I gave it a second star was that the staff was good and they were always on time when refilling drinks.

The portions are large, and the prices are relatively reasonable, however, the food was just flat out crap. The first time I went there, I ordered Fish & Chips. It was completely bland, as if the cook completely forgot to salt it. The breading was also extremely heavy and completely soaked in grease. It was so thick that you couldn't even tell if there was fish inside.

I went a second time and got the jambalaya which was served in a large bowl. This time it was just salty and greasy, and the bottom of the bowl just had a large pool of grease. You could probably mop the floor of the entire restaurant and half the parking lot with all the grease and still have enough left over to coat a large mammal.

Let me start off by saying this is a beautiful restaurant/pub and had a great ambiance. I really wanted to like it. As for the food, well, in one word bleck!! I don't care if that's a word or not but that's how all of us felt after we attempted to eat there. We started off with the chips and salsa which came with bean dip and cheese (tasted like it came straight out of a can and into the micro.) and guac( must have come in a squeeze tube.  Not Fresh. Oh yeah, we waited 20 minutes for this app. After we were half way thru it, another duplicated order of chips and salsa came out. Uh, no thanks, one crappy one is enough.  Our entrees included fish and chips, 1/2 rack of ribs and a bacon cheese burger. The fries on all three plates tasted old, flavorless and we all agreed, the worst any of us have had ever. The burger was so overcooked it literally tasted like licking the bottom of the grill. All of us tried it and I had to gargle my weak, watered down iced tea to try to get the nastiness out of my mouth. As for the ribs, flavorless and salty and very uninspiring. The fish and chips, er, I mean tasteless, and nasty fries, well the fish wasn't too bad but did have a bit of freezer burn taste to it.  Maybe this Is a good place to have drinks and some selectful apps, but do not waste your time with dinner or lunch for that matter. This place will not survive. It's just plain fact that if you serve overprocessed crap, your customers will eventually stop coming. We will never go back and I highly recommend you not to. If you have too see for yourself, go for drinks and share a couple food items, you'll see. Don't say I didn't tell you, especially the fries, ugh, how can you screw up something so simple.

If you like watching sports and drinking then do not go to Miller's Alehouse. This is a great place to socialize and whatnot but there are much better places to watch sports. There are plenty of TVs but the manager prefers pop music at 5PM during a Stanley Cup playoff game than letting people hear the game. Mostly everyone was watching the game but the manager thought it to be a good business decision to keep the music on at 5PM instead. A simple solution would be sound boxes or the manager could simply know his clientele.
Ordered the Fish & Chips...HORRIBLE!!! They changed the Cod Fish to Pollack. Menu still says fluffy white fish. Since when is Pollack considered a White Fish?!?

Dined late on a Saturday night. Bar areas were very crowded but the restaurant itself was tame. We started with mt st helens boneless wings, they call 'em zingers. The sauce was mildly spicy, then again, we like 'em HOT! The husband had the Red Hot chicken sandwich and I had the blackend prime rib with sweet potatoe fries. The fries were the highlight not saying the rest was bad it's just  that it's your average pub grub. Service was friendly, draft beer selection isn't as extensive as you might think. However, we were able to try a couple that tend to be rare finds elsewhere.

This place is simple yet effective.  

Perfect for game day, because you're surrounded by TV's.  Bad for a romantic dinner, because you're surrounded by TV's.  

Big menu, but I've found a couple of favorites that I order time and time again.

Decent drink specials and good draft variety.  

Usually the service is great, although last time I am pretty sure our waitress was high.  Still entertaining, though.

All-in-all, we're fans.  You should be, too.

Are you a person who loves things? Well get ready to add this place to your long list of things you love. Miller's Ale House strives to be your first, your last, your everything at Town Square. Whether you're watching a game, meeting up with visitors to Vegas or just want a great meal at a great price this place is the total package. 

My friends and I have visited Miller's Ale House for a number of reasons since it has opened. Our first venture we heard there was outdoor seating and were tired of being cooped up in a windowless bar. We enjoyed sitting by the fire on the patio and since seasons haven't been TOTALLY eliminated in Vegas there are misters for when it's hot and heaters for when it's cold. We've also visited to watch all-important NFL games on Sunday. Not only are there great drink specials like $7 pitchers and bargain cocktails, but they also post a map of where your game will be shown! No more moving all of your friends when the TV above you is showing professional bowling. Miller's Ale House also works for a bite to eat after a shopping marathon or en route to the strip. Only one word is required when speaking of the food there: Zingers. Dare I say if you don't try them you will live a life of regret. 

Overall, great place for lots of occasions. The staff is friendly, there are tons of seats and more TV's than your eyeballs can handle. Try it out!

Had dinner there last night after catching a flick at AMC.  I ordered zingers (chicken fingers) & picked the sweet thai chili sauce along w/ an entree house salad & an iced tea.  The zingers were great, nice white meat chicken tenderloins & the sauce was super yum!  The house salad could use some work, I found lots of wilted lettuce pieces, some of which had dark brown/black areas over them, ok maybe a lot of work.  The freshness just wasn't there, probably best to skip the salads & just go for the fried stuff, its a bar not really known for there farm fresh ingredients, thats for sure.  But service was awesome, ambiance was kick back casual w/ lots of tv's & they had some good happy hour specials.  Good place to go for game nights & drinks.

So far things are going well. Cool place decorated well. Sports on every flat screen in the place and sense I'm not in to that sort of thing I will leave that alone.  I have ordered a cheddar cheeseburger and fries so we will see how that goes when it gets here..........So the burger and fries are awesome and you must try the Cajun Ranch dipping sauce. Menu is well planned and the timing and temperature of the food is spot on. Only complaint is the booth seats are wood and have no padding. A must try I think you will like.

The food was a bit bland, I ordered the chicken w/sweet potatoes fries. My drink was not made properly but instead of telling me they didn't make them they tried so that's awesome!! Our waitress didn't have a pen so she kept coming back and asking us our drink and food order. The place is a laid back and good bar other wise.

Food is good, the drink prices are AMAZING and the amount of tv's to watch your favorite sport or team can't be beat! The service on game days can be almost non existant and they need more servers those days which is why I give it 4 stars. I dig that is has 2 bars and two outside seating areas though. I go there at least 2 times a month.
Great family place. Tuesdays kids eat free!!! Service was great and the food is good.

Went here to watch the UFC fights last weekend. The place was pretty crowded, but we were seated within 10 minutes. No cover charge for the pay per view was nice too. The food was great, the service was great, and the prices for everything were very reasonable! 
PS- We returned here the following Monday afternoon to kill some time with out of town friends that were waiting to fly back home. Same great food, no crowd, and the "Happy Hour" prices were super cheap!
Good atmosphere for watching football but bad food. Do not get the hickory chicken sandwich! The bun is dry and too big and the chicken tastes microwaved.

we have come here many times when we don't have time to cook but need to eat. the service had never been bad whenever we came. and we haven't ordered anything that is awful. we always order the same stuff such as burger, salmon, prime rib special (for tues and thurs), flat bread and chicken pasta. all are pretty simple and safe items, hard to go wrong. no complaints. we also like that they open till late even on weekdays, so it is a plus for us especially when we couldn't make it there at usuall dinner hours before 9pm.

hence i am giving 4 stars, mainly for the purpose of a comfortable environment to eat and no bad food experience so far. i wouldnt say that the food is supberb, but not awful or inedible. even when they undercooked my burger once, they sincerely corrected the issue.
I've been here quite a few times, the service is good the food is good.. Keeps us coming back! (: the calamari is yummy too!!

One of our favorite spots for sure. Large menu and drink menu and the food never disappoints. We always get the flat iron steak w shrimp for only $16.99 and it also comes with 2 sides. Joey (our server) was awesome tonight also. Very attentive and kind.

I've been here a couple times and decided to come in for New Year's Eve. My friend wanted to do something festive and close to the fireworks but with seating and a bit more casual. They had a $50 all you can eat/open bar package which we thought was a great deal. The restaurant wasn't too crowded and the server was fantastic. She had a lot of demanding tables but still came back to check on us as much as possible. Our drinks were never empty, we both had a four course meal, and the deal was amazing. The food was good although the orders were slightly off a couple times but since our server had a lot of tables, it was understandable. The last time I was here, our server was just as good and the food was all fantastic. Nice casual place to hang out and get a good meal.

I dig Miller's Alehouse for many reasons. 1. Sports. 2. Sports. and 3. SPORTS!!! It is just  a fun chill place to be at to watch all the games with there crazy selection of HD TV's (basketball - GO CELTICS!, football - GO CHARGERS! and the bf's team EAGLES!, and they even show the UFC fights - BJ PENN!!!! 20 secs?!) Woah. 

The back area is where the hype is. More for the over 21+ age group. Everyone is more "expressive" so try not to take what people say seriously. It's just a game. Yeah right. haha. 

I haven't tried full entrees at Millers Ale House yet except for the appetizers. The "Zinger Mountain Melt" is one of the best Wing & Zingers to choose from. Crispy crunch chicken fingers and french fries with melted cheese and bacon on top. Yumm. Good enough to serve 2-3 people. 

For drinks, they know how to take care of you. They have drink specials everyday! Beer they offer average on weekdays a bucket of 5 for $8+ and on weekends 5 for $10. 

This place is a perfect spot to hang out with your friends and just have a great time.

This is my place to go to whenever I need a beer and some quick food. Service is always top quality and never had any sort of issues in the 4 years I've been coming here. If u trying to catch a big boxing/UFC fight then come here as they will always have it and usually for free. Trying to catch any major sporting event, they will have it one of there many many tvs.

Recommendations:
-On Sundays and Mondays they have the baby back ribs w/ wings for $17.99 during football games. Won't be disappointed and will leave stuffed
-35 shrimp as it's what the name says 35 shrimp and comes w/ fries.
-$8 pitchers of miller lite, which anyone knows that a great deal for vegas.

Went in last night to meet my wife. She had an incident where someone stole her purse. The management and staff were incredibly helpful and supportive. Due to their efforts we were able to track down the person and all her things were  returned! I just wanted to take the time to thank them!!! The bartenders and managers Are top notch!

post movie at AMC, the gf, my daughter and I were hungry.  We had about an hour or so before we picked up my daughter's boyfriend from the airport so we decided on a late night snack and pick up dinner for him.  It was late in the evening so we figured either Yardhouse or Miller's - since we've never been to Miller's, time to give them a try.

The place is much larger than I thought it would be.  Surprisingly, place was very busy with what appeared to be a night club feel even though no dj/dance floor.  It's definitely set up for the sports crowd - I assume primarily for NFL games

We garnered a table near the bar and was humored with overhearing the BS of pick up lines by men ( and women ) through out our meal.

The gf was trying to be a good girl - ordered a side salad.  Daughter ordered the lobster bisque.  I ordered chicken fingers ( they have a cool name for them but the name escapes me ) and some sliders.  Given the heat, I opted for a Leinenkugel Summer Shanty.  later I tried the other Leinnie summer selection ( has a citrus-y flavor as opposed to the berry hint in the shanty )

The lobster bisque was subpar - tasted like cheese soup with a tablespoon of lobster nestled on top.  The server noticed my daughters disappointment and offered to replace the soup with another selection - she opted for the clam chowder.  The chowder was much better.

The sliders were decent;  the chicken fingers/strips were very tasty - the girlfriend tried one and that transformed her from "rabbit mode" to "rabid mode" - she then ordered two desserts ( pics included )  - 

Some sort of ice cream cake with peanut butter/fudge and a nutter butter crust.  she also ordered chocolate cake.  She loved the peanut butter thingy - it did little for me and the chocolate cake was very average.  While eating the dessert it pissed me off - if I had known she was going to turn dessert crazy I would've made the walk to the Meatball Spot for their ice cream sammies ( assuming they were open ) 

Overall, Millers is ok - it's basically a mega sized sports bar which is ok by me.

I might return

Mediocre theme restaurant/bar.  Went for Monday night football with a friend.  There weren't many places to sit and we ended up at a table with a great view of the bathrooms.

The Sam Adams beer on special was completely average.  The zingers were pretty good.  My friend ordered the ribs and he really enjoyed them.  

Our server was friendly and attentive.  My only issue with the service was that the staff kept trying to take our plates away when they still had food on them, and tried to remove beer glasses when there was a few ounces remaining in the glass.  

I get that they're under orders from management to keep the tables clean, but we were there to watch football and relax while eating and drinking some beer.  It was irritating that someone came by to try to clear the table every 2 mins.  The server needs to communicate better with the bussers and food runners.  

I may come back but not before checking out other bars.

I'll start off by saying the waiter was extremely nice and fast. This complaint is not about him at all. The food came out quickly.. please to everyone that goes to this place please look at your food before eating. My boyfriend found HAIR in his zinger salad. Absolutely disgusting!! This is seriously the worst experience I have had here. Very disappointed and grossed out.

One of the worst casual dining experiences I've ever had. Fried mozzarella that wasn't melted, a huge platter of chicken nachos with hardly any cheese, and unbelievably bland chicken fingers called "Zingers."  All of the food had potential, but was all poorly executed. The Zingers, for example, which I ordered in Mango Habanero had little to no sauce whatsoever, and even the sides of ranch are served less than half full. Clearly the manager is worried about food costs, but the result is inedible food that won't bring anyone back. The kicker had to be the female waitress who didn't wash her hands after using the restroom and walked right past my wife and daughter at the sink.

The worst seafood combo I've ever had! Being a company based out of Florida, this is the worst! Honestly, long john silver is better. I had the seafood combo & shrimp were small & over poked as well as the calamari. The scallops were still frozen & when I showed the bartender & manager, the manager said its because they are frozen. That doesn't explain why they aren't done & very disappointed. Terrible bar food! Stick with the Zingers & Seafood MAC OR JAMBALAYA. BARTENDERS & service is great. Except the frozen seafoods! Great place for UFC!!!
My contact info is 702-290-2150. You didn't leave a name or even email to make things better!

All I can say is WOW!!!!  We love Miller's and go as often as we can.  Today Being our sons birthday he wanted to go to Miller's.  We all ordered and upon receiving my meal the steak was not cooked to order.  They sent the steak back and manager ( so sorry i did not get her name, working on 9.2.17 @ 2pm) brought the new order out and asked me to check the steak.  Unfortunately it was more rare then the previous one.  I just asked to remove the steak form the bill.  To our surprise she  had already done that.  Once the rest of the family was finished we asked for the check and to our surprise yet AGAIN she took care of the whole bill.  At no point did we EVER intend not to pay for everything else we ordered.  We left a generous tip and thanked the manager.  We have lived in Las Vegas for 20 plus years and this is the best service that we have received.   We will be back again!!  Thank you Miller's Ale House @ Town Square.

The zingers my husband got were great, HOWEVER I didn't like the ribs I got. They had a weird flavor. The kids menu also CLEARLY stated grilled chicken with veggies, so I ordered it and when it came out the waiter said that I was wrong it came with French fries.

This is more of a football/sports review than anything. 

I definitely like the place - it has great daily specials, the food is good, and sports viewing is normally good if you're just going for one game.  However, getting management to bend on which TVs are showing which game, or where the sound is on, is consistently a struggle. 

I've had multiple instances where they have refused to put on a game outside, or inside, based upon what seems to be arbitrary placement. I have seen patrons get up and leave because they won't broadcast the game everyone seems to want to see.

Recently, I asked for a TV to be changed in an area where a large group was looking to watch one main game, and was steadfastly refused in what felt like a kind of rude way. After some pressing, it turned out that these TVs were linked to one box, and would have interrupted someone else who was watching a different game across the restaurant, but that wasn't explained until we'd been rudely told "the TVs don't change." We'd have been more than understanding with just the actual reason.

Anyways, good food, good prices, normally solid service, just be careful if you're dead set on watching a particular game, because they probably won't budge.

I used to love this place.  Now it's pretty ridiculous.  I've been a bartender/server for 18 years and I've never seen such a cluster of poor employees in my life.  First off waiting over 10 mins for drinks at a bar with two bartenders and 3 people sitting at the bar is a bit absurd.  Then when you order a common shot (surfer on acid) and neither bartender knows how to make it without a drink rolodex, it's sad.  It just demonstrates how poor managment has become and how little they care about the quality of their product and satisfaction of their guests.

I came here with my Girlfriend from LA to watch the Canelo vs Cotto fight after I was surprised to find out that you could not watch the fights in the Las Vegas Strip hotels. Apparently there is a rule where they cannot show PPV fights, I did not know this. Long Story short, if you did find a place to watch the fight in the strip it would cost your +$85 per person for cover. I found out that Miller's Ale House was showing the fight for just a $10 per person and it's only a few blocks away from the strip. 

I came here early, got a comfortable spot (community seating). Eventually it got crowded, there was some people who could not handle their drinking and had to be escorted out. The security was quick to diffuse the situation. 

Between me and my girlfriend, we ordered 10 beers and like 4-5 appetizers and it was under -$100 dollars. I could not believe it!!! I knew we were drinking so i had to double check the bill. I tipped our waiter (i think he was the owner? Steve?) like +$25 bucks because he did a great job. He was funny, and attentive. 

Bonus: The people we sat next to were also from LA too! We all agreed that the next time there is a really good boxing fight we would all come back here again. They were super cool people, didn't feel awkward (for meeting them for the first time).

I will definitely recommend to my friends.

I ordered the fish and chips and they tasted that they were made last week. Definitely made in old oil. Then we we ordered a pitcher of beer and it came only 3/4 full. The bartender didn't want to fill up the pitcher. Like it costs them anything!

 Won't be going back.
Excellent service, decent portions, kid-friendly! Very impressed with whole experience esp on a weekend! Will be coming back as regulars! Can't wait to try their Sangrias!

This has been a regular place for me as I used to work in townsquare. Reason for my 5 star review is the bar staff. Steven, Dominique, and Reece are my favs!! Food is consistent and love how they cater to us service industry people. Congrats on graduating nursing school Dom!!

Great for Sunday and Monday football action.

Been there a ton of times and never had a bad meal.  

Awesome drink specials.
The food!!!!! The food!!!! The food!!!! Every thing on their menu is AMAZING,  but the Ossobuco is the best ive had in Vegas.

This used to be one of our favorite places to eat. This place has taken a huge nose dive! The service is absolutely horrible and the food is very hit or miss. Tuesday's are supposed to be kids eat free but you have to remind your server because every time we've gone they "forget". I don't know what has happened here but this will be our last visit.

This isn't a review about food or drinks. This is a review about the bike night they have there. They were kind enough to let this be a drop off station for the hurricane relief!! They coordinated it just right with a big biker night to get so many donations. The vibe was great in there. Everyone was happy and entertained. I liked the set up for the 2 separate bars. The employees were upbeat. I will definitely be back for drinks.

Disgusting, overpriced, unpalatable food.  My friend ordered a chicken sandwich today.  Wish I'd taken a photo.  It looked like my 10 year old niece overcooked the chicken in a microwave with sections of un-melted cheese.  I thought we were being punked with hidden cameras.  It tasted equally as bad.  I've been to Miller's before and never can find anything anything remotely appetizing on the menu.  Today I settled for an $8 side salad and vowed never to return.  

The servers, however, have always been attentive with zero complaints.

Poop. Poor service. Poor staffing. Had an issue there about a month when.........finally someone spoke with me he was a total jerkoff for lack of a better word. Almost certain his last name was Corona.

I want to love Miller's Ale House Las Vegas, but never can :(

Location - excellent in Town Square. Easy parking. Easy to go pick up your printing and buy a quick laptop or two and some highlighters at Staples (less then 100 feet from the door) - however that is where the fun stops.

Well, maybe if a major fight is going on, it is a good place - as they usually don't charge a cover for them.

Service - tries too hard, yet fails in every way possible.  A "fake" friendly, and highly trained sales people. Want to split a burger, no problem, but first let me tell you about every item on the menu - in detail ... geeee, thanks.

Food - well, as soon as you walk up to the door, you can smell the grease :( However, if you get the daily special (which are usually "not bad") it is a decent financial deal. Watch for the add-ons or substitutions they will get you for thou.

Oh, and don't expect lemon in your water! :)

I go back every few months - for convenience reasons only. Usually leaving with more noises in my stomach then when I went in.
Versatile menu, good service, great beer selection, lots of TVs. Very casual. One of my favorite places.

Nice place to meet up with some friends and eat food. The food is like most any other bar. I had the sliders and some chicken tenders. Both were good. The place is a great place to meet large groups, say for an orientation or a private party. The desserts were good and I have to admit the one dessert (I forget what it's called, I think something deep treasure? it has heath chips in it) was AMAZING. I swear I'm going to go to this place just to eat this dessert. Nothing else probably. It's worth checking out.

Great food, prices & service! Will be back soon!

Got the fried shrimp basket (amazing value) as an appetizer, then the steak special (even better value)  and a few mojito pitchers - guess what, great value. 

Go here. You won't be disappointed.

This place was super busy on a Saturday night! I had no idea they would be packed! The hostess said it would be a 45 minute wait but it was only about 5 minutes. 

My favorite thing to order here is the Zingers Mountain Melt. It's fries, chicken fingers (basically), cheese and bacon. It's delicious and huge! I would recommend sharing it with someone. We also had the mozzarella sticks (yummy), chicken wings and chicken nachos. The nachos were my least favorite because they had shredded chicken and not enough toppings. 

For dessert we ordered their signature dessert (I forgot the name but I posted a picture) and the apple crisp. They were both yummy but the apple crisp was my favorite. 

My friend ordered us a pitcher of watermelon margaritas...only $10 and very good! Overall it was a yummy dinner and affordable for how much we ordered!

I love the atmosphere in this ale house! they have great menu selections and daily specials, perfect portions & pricing, and excellent service (Thanks Clay).

Miller's Ale House is set-off from shops on the south side of Town Square across the street from Fry's. It has it's own parking lot, so you don't have to worry about parking and walking a long way. It is a family restaurant with sports playing on televisions throughout the restaurant.

There are several options for seating when you enter the restaurant. Some are low light options with booths; some have natural light with lots of windows, and then there is the covered patio outside. Near the back bar area, there are tables and sofa's near a rock fireplace! The latter was my go-to option.

Today Clay helped us with our drink selection from the bar then our lunch order. He was very knowledgeable about his variety of ciders on tap. I couldn't resist! Meanwhile, my friend had a rum and coke, which comes in a tall cold glass.

We started off with the chicken zingers. They came with a great hot sauce and a lot of fries. The zingers were good. I didn't care for the fries.

We both ordered the daily lunch special - Mahi melt with cheese, Thousand Island dressing, and coleslaw all on toasted bread. The sandwich had a generous portion of mahi and the flavors were perfectly matched. This came with a choice of a side, and we both decided to have the grilled corn on the cob with garlic butter.  The corn was delicious. 

The mahi sandwich could only be improved by draining the coleslaw before topping it on the sandwich because it quickly makes your bread wet. But, if you are hungry and eat it up right away - you won't notice. 

I enjoyed the meal, the service, and the atmosphere. I highly recommend this place. I know I plan to come back for soon for Thursday's prime rib special.
Millers Ale House has good food.  Not too loud.  Friendly bartenders.  Lots of TVs with football games.  Great place
This place is good to go to if you want to drink and catch up with friends or watch a game. If you're hungry, eat at Yardhouse or anywhere else, the food is in no way impressive.
I like the prices for beer. The food is ok, definitely not awful. The atmosphere is fun and everyone is very friendly.

I had to stop here but was unable to either eat or drink.  I thought given the atmosphere, if I was ever in the area and had some time, I would hit the place up.  Today, I rolled in for a beer after dropping the boy off at the airport.  I found in a short amount of time, the service at the was not very friendly nor were they that attentive.  They seemed more concerned with chatting amongst themselves than working the bar.  I looked over the menu and noticed the "zingers" which I might come back at a later time and try.  When I found out I paid for one beer (Sam Adams) what I could have bought a six pack for in any grocery store in the valley, I felt suckered.  Maybe there was something I was missing and thought I would research Miller's Alehouse when I got home.  I could find nothing really notable and decided this place given it's location on the boulevard and it's prices is meant for the tourists.

Great experience at this location ! The service was outstanding and our waitress was very nice ! She ensured that we had everything we needed ! Food is always great and not outrageously overpriced ! They also have great deals on pitchers of beer !!

Miller House is the bomb for happy hour, lunch, and any type of casual outing with friends.
The beer selection is great and I recommend the oysters.
Didn't give it a 5 star because 50% of the time the service is so slow you start writing a letter to the manager in your head, but if you are aware and prepared for this chance you'll leave happy.

So, I've been here a few times and have had good times and bad. This place is always good about accommodating bigger groups and they always have the big games on. 

They have decent drink specials and decent food specials, but you better ask or look through the menu thoroughly! That's why they don't get more than 3 stars. I ordered a Zinger Mountain Melt ($12.99) only to find out that there was a zinger special for $5, only difference was no fries. Then I asked the waitress for their other IPAs after the one I order from the menu is no longer available. Rather than offer the IPA that's on special, she suggests, and I order, one that's $8/glass. Ale House isn't bad...no thanks to the service. They also delivered my buddy's food only to return 2 minutes later to take it back, telling him it wasn't his. And don't get me started on the bartender's lack of knowledge of alcohol on an earlier visit, suggesting Jim Beam when I ordered scotch... Maybe I should give'em 2 stars.
Great place to watch the games and have a cold one with the boys. Tv's everywhere, cute waitresses, plenty of beer options on Tap and bottle, and good food. Try the zingers!

We were here for a late dinner after the Mexico soccer game and it was good! It wasn't too full but we did have to ask an employee from the bar for a table because nobody was at the stand greeting or sitting people. She helped us right away and our waiter came to our table fast. He was a really cool guy . He recommended great plates and had great people skills . He was talking with us about sports and he was funny . I forgot to take pictures but our order for the night was Philly cheese steak sandwiches and fish and chips . Everything was good and good came out fast . I believe our waiters name was Cortea- he was great!

It's your typical bar. Got there a bit before the rest of my group & sat at the table for over 5 minutes before I finally had to ask the 6-7 waiters/waitresses that were standing at the end of my table by the POS system if I had a server. One of the waitresses made a snarky comment to another about me & if my table had a server. That's how your going to treat customers? Seriously? I can take my money elsewhere & definitely will next time. Finally after the waitress came to take my drink order a couple others in my party showed up. The waitress was good at first with coming to the table when a new person would arrive to get their drink order but as soon as they started getting a little busy she was non-existent & we had to flag her down several times to get more drinks. She also forgot several people's drinks to which they never did get. As far as the food - meh. Nachos were gross. No flavor & just a bunch of crap piled on the top of the chips. Once you took a top chip there was nothing on the chips below it. Calamari was over sauced & soggy. Chicken Wings were mediocre at best. They've also done away with their cheap all day prices instead of having a happy hour to now having a happy hour so that's a disappointment as well. I guess there's a reason that I haven't been there in a long time & was reminded why. I won't be going back there to spend my $ anymore.

Stopped by on our way back from vegas just yesterday. We were looking for the Yard House and found this spot. Glad we did. Food was delicious. I had a cheeseburger with grilled onions. Friends call shrimp scampi, chicken pasta dish, chicken salad, and jambalaya and something else plus dessert. all of us were happy with the food. it was very tasty. Even as leftovers. The only complaint was that my friend didn't eat all his jambalaya. However, the staff and manager tried to make up for it but our friend didn't want anything else since he had snaked on the dish and others. Couldn't ask for a better customer service. Recommended.

The nachos here are amazing I came here during Manny Pacquiao's last fight and the place was full! Make sure to get a booth but the staff is extremely nice and friendly! The food is amazing though it does take a little long for it to come out so you will be kinda hungry by the time you start eating! Usually on normal days it's not too busy which is great and more relaxing.

Came here for dinner with my girlfriend. Service was decent considering it was Friday night. Appetizer was good, had the chicken nachos. 
She got the build a burger for main course and I had the loaded Philly cheese steak. At this point the food went downhill in a hurry.  A few bites into my sandwich I bite into a few long blonde hairs.. After gagging and removing them from my mouth, promptly washing down a full beer to keep from throwing up, I called a manager. While looking at it we glance around at workers (my gf and I are both dark brown haired) the only blonde working is .... You guessed it, the cook.. With a long blonde ponytail. NO HAIR NET.. I explained the issue to the manager who's response was , "well he's wearing a hat.. " like it matters when his full ponytail is sticking out the back wagging around every time he turns..

Expected better from millers.

Friendly service and great atmosphere if you only want to have beers or drinks.
You pay a fair price for the food, but the food is terrible.  I would rather eat anywhere else.  If you hungry stay away, if your thirsty go have a drink and watch some sports!

I'd been looking for a place to watch the UFC fights with friends. Well...this is the place to do it! Great selection of beers, awesome wings, and a decent crowd. Very reasonably priced and good service.

Typical turn and burn chain restaurant.  You can consistently expect average service, decent food and OK pricing.  You don't get the quality customer service that you find at more reputable chains and locally owned restaurants.  The bartenders write your name on a place card that they set in front of you with their name on the other side.  I've tried to host large groups with them on more than one occasion and it was a nightmare.  The staff is ill-equipped to do more than greet you, seat  you and bring you what you ordered.  It's a shame because they have potential.

Okay, the only reason I didn't give this place 5stars is I needed to give Mama's Fish House in Maui a higher rating than here.  But that place cost about $300 for two people.

Okay, so this isn't your $50 or $150 a dinner place, but for under $20 a plate the food is great.  I had the New York Strip steak that was cooked just right and my wife had the Clam Bake that was enough food that we could have shared it alone.  And we had Calamari Rings for an appetizer that was some of the best we have ever had.  But beware; the sauce they come with is a bit spicy, very good, but a bit spicy, so just plan for it.
The service is great.  The Calamari came in about 5-10 minutes and dinner wasn't much longer and there was always someone asking if we needed anything.

This is your typical Sports bar eatery.  There are 72...YES!!  72 TV's throughout the place so no matter where you sit, you can catch "the game".  AND! if this isn't a good enough review for you, then get this..There are 23 beers on tap.  So even if the food and service were only a 1-star the choice of beers makes it worth it a visit.

But the food is good, the service is great and the price is great too.  So here's the deal.  Just freakin' go and check the place out.  I mean c'mon, the worst case scenario is you spend $25 for food and a beer.

It was July and what I remember it was a decent place. I liked the waitress as she was chipper and fast,  that's what you want! We just ordered the appetizers because we were headed to a memorial service. My cousin ordered the nachos, they are okay, nothing special! Nachos are nachos, you can't mess those up! We ordered the spicy buffalo shrimp.  Again,  nothing to brag about,  it was breaded fried shrimp coated in buffalo sauce. Yes, they were good! Oh I almost forgot about the jumbo chicken wings,  they were delicious, and crispy,  I wanted more! I guess I have to order from the full menu to get the whole experience.  Would I go back? Yes I would and I would order a meal and try some cocktails.

This place is pure awesomeness.  There are Tv's everywhere, and they play sound to the games.  The food is decently priced and what we ordered was delicious.  The zinger melt which is like like cheese fries with chicken tenders on top is a fat mans dream. The seafood mac was good as well, I love that they have sweet tea.  They gave us happy hr cards which can be used anytime so that was cool.  I had the buried treasure desert which was good but not amazing.  I will definitely be back.

Located in Town Square, it is a great location for some food and drinks!

We stopped in after our shopping excursion to appease our appetite.  They were very friendly as soon as we walked in the door.  As soon as we sat down, our waiter was over with happy friendly service. 

Our entire table spilt the fiesta nachos.  As an appetizer for 4, it was perfect.  The plate of nachos were piled high with plenty of toppings all around.  Something else to share is the Miller's Steak Sandwich.  I split this with my husband.  It was filled with marinated steak, onions, mushrooms and provolone.  So delicious and filling!  Tip~ if you order sweet potato fries on the side, it is a HUGE basket and can also be shared.  

This location has good service and good food!  Just a great option when in the area!

It was 10pm and I googled "steak" and Miller's Ale House was the only one close by and still open.

I had the choice between fish n chips or the special for the evening - prime rib.

I asked my server (Lindy) which she would recommend and she (almost embarrassingly) replied, "The prime rib is pretty good" (like ... "I hate to brag, but our prime rib is d@#n good!") ... and it WAS!

Kudos to you Miller's Ale House for putting out a really nice piece of prime rib!

I love Lawry's Prime Rib in Beverly Hills and I kid you not - Miller's can hold its own and for $13 on a Tuesday Night Special!

But, I really want to give Lindy a huge shout out! She's pretty & very professional - which was just the icing to meal!

Typically, the prime rib is gone by 7pm so I lucked out this late of a night!

I also have to say that Carlos (the Manager) was very ingratiating and so helpful - even to the point of bussing my table. It threw me off (for just a second) when this well-dressed man came up to clear my salad plate so I asked, "Either a nice patron is clearing my table or you're the manager of this place!"

It always speaks volumes of an establishment when the leader of the team leads by example ... a "servant leader" if you will!

I will definitely be back to visit Lindy & Carlos and try their fish n chips!
Miller's is always a great time, and great food. I recommend the Prime Rib French Dip, best thing ever.

Update:
The manager reached out and invited me back. The service was good and the food was tasty. It appears that that first night was an unusual experience. 
I really like that they took the time to address my complaint and name sure my next experience there was pleasant. 

*******************
Possibly some of the worst food I've had in quite a while...the atmosphere was ok but the service in food were beyond unacceptable. Not only did it take like 40 minutes to get appetizers and 20+ for our drinks...when the food finally arrived it was horrible. The fries tasted as if they collected all of the leftovers from the day before...refrigerated it...then microwaved it the next day...they were rubbery and gross. The appetizers (when the flatbread and mozzarella sticks finally arrived) were cold and underwhelming. The only decent dish was the wings. The review probably would have received 2/3 stars but they even got the drinks wrong and service took a long time at a restaurant that wasn't even that full... will not be going back.
This is a very laid back upscale pub. It's at great location to watch the game. The 5 dollar appetizers during happy hour are well worth it!

Millers is my friends favorite go-to sports bar so every time I'm in town he insists that we hang out here to watch the game in the back bar area.  The bar area is open and very lively, patrons yelling at the T.V,'s and at each other in good rivalry fun.  The drinks are really good specifically the rum and coke, they have daily happy hour specials. The food at Millers however...not so good.  I ordered the Shrimp Scampi...lacking in flavor, I had to keep adding salt and STILL felt like it didn't have enough flavor.  I stopped adding salt when I felt I became in jeopardy of my blood pressure going up!

I love this place!  I have been here numerous times and have never been disappointed! The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and professional; Management is exceptional. Food?  Spectacular!! The specials menu highlights daily lunch and dinner options that are filling and delicious at a great value! 
And then there are the Zingers! 15 flavors of freshly made hand breaded boneless chicken tenders tossed in your choice of sauce. $5.00 onTuesdays! There are so many choices here, you have to visit more than once if you are visiting Fabulous Las Vegas. You can have anything from Grilled Mahi Mahi to Shrimp Scampi or Steamed Clams, Steak, Burgers, Chicken or an excellent selection of salads!!!
Well done! Thanks!! John, Tim, Amber, and Kimmi. Wish we had a Millers inConnecticut

Solid bar food! The only reason I come here is because of the food which says a lot because I'm not into sports at all & listening to a bunch of guys yelling about who scored whatever annoys me to the fullest. 
There's lots of great menu options & from all the sports bars in town this happens to be my favorite.
Zingers are always great with many sauce options, the Cajun chicken pasta is perfectly spicy, the steak sandwich is always tender, and they have many great daily specials for lunch & dinner. The prices are low & the food is tasty! Can't beat that!
If you happen to visit on a busy evening which seems to always be my luck expect to wait for a table! If you happen to be a lady who enjoys sports this place is perfect for you because you get the games & a bunch of rowdy guys all hyped up about sports :)
Rather than cleaning the table at the bar, the waiter asked me to sit somewhere else. It's the bar sitting area, the table wasn't dirty. A different approach would have been nice.

The food isn't worth the price. A regular cheese burger is $15 not including a side! It doesn't come with condiments, you have to put it on by yourself.. 
Horrible customer service, I was given my receipt expecting my change that wasn't given to me. I went to go talk to the cashier and explain what happened, because I thought they took my change. And then my waiter came by and gave me my change (finally) and said " here you deal with it" with attitude. Didn't leave them a tip. Never going back!!!!!

Every time I go to Miller Ale House I have a good experience.  The food is always great, it is the best part; well that and the $7 Miller light pitchers!!  The only reason they don't get 5 stars is the service is always a little slow, not horrible by any means, just a little slow.  My fiance always gets the blackened Prime rib sandwich, he loves it!!!  And also loves the fact he can get sweet potato fries.  I try something new every time.  This time I got the Pulled pork.  It was good, the toasted garlic bread it comes on is great!  The portions are huge and the price is more than fair.  We bring a lot of out of towners here as well, never have they been disappointed.  
It is a great place for watching sports, enjoying always cheap drinks and knowing you food will be consistent!  If you haven't gone, GO~
Good drink selection. All the drinks I've had here I've enjoyed. The employees aren't that friendly but I go for the drinks so it doesn't bother me much.

The steak salad was good and big,. Bothe the steak and Philly steak sandwich were quite tasty. Good price for a good portion of food. I am from Cali, so LV is the closest but hey it's only a 45 minute flight!!

I was torn between rating this 3 or 4 stars, but what pushed it to 4 for me was the fact that they gave me a carnation for Valentine's Day!!! My boyfriend and I decided to try out Miller's after seeing all the ads for their specials around Town Square. We ended up going on Valentine's Day, and they had a special menu, but we didn't try anything off of it. 

I read about their famous "Zingers" here on Yelp so we ordered some hot Zingers and a dozen oysters to start. The Zingers were really great and went well with the beer -would definitely recommend! The oysters were pretty much what you can expect from a "bar-food" type place like this. They were $14 for a dozen, and I don't think I would order them again. I can get a dozen for around the same price fresh at Whole Foods down the street and they taste much better.
